comments.text: If I remember well, there's a town service dropping you close to the motorway. I'll try to find which one it is exactly !
When going to Lattaquia, someone dropped me here. Excellent spot to hitch, like every little point on the side of motorways in Syria !

Here is the spot I used to hitchhike for one year when I wanted to go up North. Never waited more than 10min. Moreover, we were 3 that time. If you want to hitchhike in Syria, good think to know is that you just have to raise your hand whenever and wherever you want. Someone will always take you after only few seconds/minutes waiting. You don't need any boards like in Europa. Enjoy, salaam

Here is the spot I used to hitchhike for one year when comin back from the university Al Qalamoon to Damascus. Never waited more than 10min. Moreover, we were 3 that time. If you want to hitchhike in Syria, good think to know is that you just have to raise your hand whenever and wherever you want. Someone will always take you after only few seconds/minutes waiting. Enjoy, salaam
Excellent spot for hitching into every direction of the country, especially towars Turkey and Lake Assad in the east. Easy to reach from the train station. Just hitchhike somewhere along the street.
Spot for hitchhiking east towards Al-Raqqah, Lake Assad, Deir ez-Zur. To catch rides within seconds, best is to walk some 100m up the road away from the locals who take the minibusses.
This border is hitchhikeable ! If you want to go to lebanon, it's a faster option than the homs one !

When going to Aleppo, I was stucked in a petrol station just before Homs. Someone dropped me and my sister who just arrived in syria here. I think some services did not want us to hitchhike this time. Anyway, after trying the two sides (hide officers were telling us cars to aleppo were on the other side, true story !!), we finally found a car to Hama. Don't care about it, I'm pretty sure it was expectionnal. It never happened after. Plus, i'm pretty sure this service station was sort of good opt
